DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether modulation dietary lipid effective treatment obesity comorbidities .
DOC.brief_title: Dietary Lipids , Energy Expenditure Obesity Biomarkers
DOC.detailed_description: Obesity complex disease multifactorial etiology difficult control . Among lifestyle change propose treatment disease comorbidities , modulation dietary lipid composition . This study aim evaluate effect modulation fatty acid ( FA ) polyunsaturated ( PUFA ) monounsaturated ( MUFA ) energy expenditure ( EE ) , weight loss , body composition , lipid glycemic profile , free fatty acid ( FFA ) , glycerol , adiponectin , leptin , blood pressure ( BP ) , feed behavior expression PPARα PPARγ2 gene adipose tissue ( AT ) obese woman . It conduct parallel , randomize , control , single-blind study dietary intervention ( DI ) 60 day , 32 woman obesity class I II distribute three group : G1 = diet rich n-3 PUFA n-6 ( n = 10 ) ; G2 = MUFA-rich diet ( n = 11 ) ; G3 = control ( n = 11 ) . For G1 G2 prescribe normocaloric diet similar macronutrient composition , vary type lipid offer . In order achieve desire intake unsaturated FA , group receive individual portion vegetable oil form sachet , consume lunch dinner ( G1 = mix virgin olive oil [ VOO ] soybean oil [ SO ] , overall 35.2g 52.8g / day ; G2 = VOO , overall 35.2g 50.6 g / day ) , besides gelatin capsule ( G1 = 2 g fish oil / day ; G2 = 1 capsule 1g SO / day ) . G3 instruct keep eating habit consume placebo ( 1 sachet 2g SO 1 capsule 1g SO / day ) .
DOC.criteria: obesity grade I II ( body mass index 30 39,99 kg/m2 ) ; completion basic education ( former 4th primary series ) . menopausal ; weight loss three kilogram ( 3 kg ) last three month ; diagnosis diabetes mellitus , heart disease , hypertension , nephropathy , liver disease , thyroid dysfunction ; gastrointestinal disorder , acquire immunodeficiency syndrome cancer ; cholecystectomy past 12 month recent surgery ; pregnancy lactation ; smoker ; drug lipidlowering , diabetes , hypertension , depression , obesity ; food history allergy intolerance vegetable oil ( olive oil , soy canola ) , fish oil , fish / seafood .
